title: Courage of the Collosus is OP but ... if only the other resolve tree keystones were good,
body:
personally i would say to get rid of the flat  base alltogether. that's 190 shield less at lvl 18

but its also the first viable tank keystone i feel has good interaction from a gameplay perspective.
big impact shield with the longest Cooldown out of all the keystones 
and lets not forget the shield lasts for 4 seconds and 1-2 seconds of that your target wont be doing damage anyway because you stunned/knocked em away.


I just wish riot would take a look at undying grasp and Bond of stone. they feel pathetic compared to any other keystone out there.

replies.body: Bond of stone especially is such a waste of a keystone. They could definitely come up with something better than some "hidden stats" as they refer to things like that.
That feeling when your keystone damage reduction is negated by a mid tier mastery from a different tree{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}
techincally 4 of them form 2 different trees

Its especially bad now that since almost everyone who benefits from Bond can just grab courage, and build {{item:3109}}, which has better reduction stats, heals you, and also comes with some decent base stats.  Only downside is that it only affects 1 person.

Knights Vow is currently just straight up better Bond of Stone. Most tanky supports might as well take colossus and get knights vow. Now they essentially have both keystones except the one from knights vow is actually good.

Not saying bond of stone is good, but the argument "Knights Vow is..." is simply stupid.
Bond of stone and that item don't exclude it's other or stand in any such relation.
If we'd double the value for both things,Bond would suddenly be strong while Knights Vow is still straight up better.
I could also say BT is a straight better Warlords, as it gives 20% lifesteal at all times rather than just at low health, all while giving a shield and more ad than fervor without needing to stack up like fervor.

**Compareing an items power to a keystone is pointless!**

Bond of stone is bad because it's bad, regardless of what Knights Vow does.

However, Bond of Stone and Courage of the Colossus are both mutually exclusive Keystones and thus have to be compared to each other since they compete for the same space.

As long as Knight's Vow exists, then Courage of the Colossus is even better since you don't really give up Bond of Stone as there is a good item that emulates the same effect.
Tank mains are ridiculous, they already have the most broken mastery in the game and now they want the other 2 to be as broken too, lol.

"Tank mains are ridiculous, they have one meta mastery and would like to have other options for champs that may not be able to utilize it as well".

It's like saying since the offensive tree already has Deathfire Touch they should make sure Fervor sucks. Or that because Windspeaker's Blessing exists Thunderlords shouldn't be as good. Different champions take advantage of these masteries and that needs to be reflected in the viability of the choices.

CoC on live is completely broken (and even after the PBE nerfs it will still be a VERY strong keystone, maybe still too strong) but I think this post is  moreso trying to focus on the fact that the Bond of stone/Grasp are underwhelming compared to other keystones in the game. 

Grasp is like a better, slightly different version of greenfather's gift; its not fit to be a keystone.
But tank is not invincible. It can be destroyed by those who know how to counteract. Example: I know how to kill a Rammus using an AD champion, in a 1v1 fight, without life steal items.

a level 18 rammus with thornmail vs any level 18 adc without lifesteal wins. everytime. bar none. always. period. there is no "I can win this if I play right" that in and of itself is as close to 100% countered in the game.

not if that adc has red buff. or and if has any mr and still has movement speed to kite. ramus aint getting no where.
people forget that even though riot tells people that they have to peel for adcs adcs have tools to peel for themselves too
yeah if the adc has red buff .. and no damage because he stacked armor, and want to engage in a 120 second fight I guess its possible for the adc to win. but then your gonna lose the game anyways.

pretty sure you were talking about a 1v1 fight with adc and ramus which almost never could happen and that blood thruster only beats thorn mails and adcs can just kite through ramus passive.. and crit through ramus when its down i was only meaning thornmails ramus veruss adc with red bufff
I'm not sure if this is a smurf or not. Regardless, you shouldn't be doing such bold statements on a level 18 account.
Undying grasp is underrated as hell, it's fucking fantastic for early trading.
it's good on top lane tanks, jungle tanks or support tanks not so much, and even top lane it's the dmg it offers in trades that makes it good not sustain or tank value
The sustain should not be underestimared, it is often the difference between a good or bad trade.
Of all the nerfs I've heard for this mastery, this is the only one that makes sense; makes it useful for tanks and no-one else, as it should be in the defensive tree.

yea its going be 7%>5% most likely but w/e still not bad 25% max shield is still good

just really pissed at the 45-30 sec based on lvl part.

Whatever the other masteries are, I hope they aren't cooldown based. Tanks need some more Innate Beefiness

replace bos with a nasus/sion/veigar style keystone: bonus armor/mr for each minion/monster kill and each champ kill/assist. Less likely to be broken than giving bonus hp because you can't reach 100% immunity with armor/mr -- cap out at 99% or something and mortal reminder and lord dominick's would still remove much of this armor due to % penetration. Probably have to go with very low armor/mr per kill though like 0.5 or something. You make tradeoff of having crap early game in return for great late game.

Thus after killing 200 minions, you have 100 bonus armor/mr. So that's actually probably a bit too generous, but i'm sure Riot could find a good number.

as much as I'd love Sion with this change, I'm scared non-tanks will grab this item and become unstoppable.




like tank ekko
any bruiser. I would take that every day on riven. But I take CoTC also

Not having BoS is absolute hell when your ADC gets engaged on. I'd say it's still preferable on supports that already synergize with anti-engage.

And Grasp is free sustain. Sustain is toxic since it invalidates trades. It's intentionally kept subpar since even the slightest in-game advantage will make it snowball.

A little extra health is worth nothing at lv 18 bro. At least on tanks it isn't. If anything give it less base health as the game goes on. That way non-cinderhulk tanks aren't completely screwed over by your suggested change.

Riven has broken a 60% win rate in Plat+ ranked game play running CoC.

You tell me if 180 is a lot on a champ that generally maxes at about 2 - 2.2k health.

She doesn't have that winrate because of a little extra health and lv 18. Do you have any idea how fast ADCs and mages melt that at lv 18?

If you are playing a tank, bos is bad. take either of the other coc or grasp and force the enemy bot lane to focus you. You will win if your adc and you are not boosted. If you are playing a disengage squishy, take shield/healing keystone -- why play janna or lulu with bos? That's just stupid.

It's almost like Windspeaker's boosts your shield strength, allowing you to protect your ADC.

enemy adc goes up to last hit, but has taric stun staring him/her in the face: adc get's the cs and takes free poke from taric and his adc; or adc doesn't get the cs. #forcingENEMYadcTOfocusTHEtankSUPPORT
Cuz that was hard?
And YES. Always take windspeaker on a shield/heal support. I posted explaining why you don't take bos on TANK supports. I personally wouldn't take BOS on any support because you are either a damage support like brand or vel and should run dft or thunderlord, a tank support like taric, braum, leona and should run coc or grasp, or a shield/heal support like janna, lulu, sona, raka who should run windspeaker. Running coc, grasp, bos, thunderlord, or dft on a shield/heal support like sona or lulu doesn't maximize your ability to carry.
Focusing Taric will do nothing if he managed to line his stun up. He already has a shield and a heal.

The other resolve keystones are good.

Bond of Stone is dramatically underrated because the way it works is very unimpactful, but even that 4% damage reduction is really strong for a keystone.

Yea, CoC is somewhat OP right now(though mostly so for lane), but it's not as broken as most poeople make it out to be as it's only 4sec, procs on the forst cc you do wether you want it or not and has a big cd. Playing around a rather short shield that has a big cd is actually quite possible.
With the PBE nerfs, it will probably be perfectly fine, still strong enough to punish people that throw all their **burst **into the initiateing **tank**(focus the tank shouldn't be a valid taktik if you don't pack heavy tankbusters or find him really out of position), but less abuseable in lane.

Now, even if balanced, it still will be used 100% on most melees with reliable hard CC, and tanks/fighters without hard cc will still not get used that much, and if they do they don't go resolve, **because the resolve tree overall still sucks, bpnd of stone and grasp are both quite weak, and grasp imo fails the tree by beeing damage oriented rather than helping to survive, and bond is just quite a bit boring and hard to notice, and lower ranks still are bad overall.**
Now add in the bad spot of new fervor, and fighters like Shyvana or Garen have no really statisfying option at all.

for garen i just go thunderlords i get flat armor pen *cough cough* lethality and that works better at taking down squishies so i dont consider it to be too much of an issue.

shyvana just got massive objective controll buffs (something she is good at anyways) so i dont think she will be in too much of a bad spot
that reminds me garen is going to get a massive buff also with those armor pen buffs to E on the pbe
